tizo_trico wrote:
> Hi there,
>
> I have some general questions about Heritrix:
>
> 1- Can the same instance of Heritrix be configured so two ore more
> crawls run at the same time?
Not in the same instance of Heritrix.  Either run two instances of the 
Heritrix application, or, use a new, little-tested feature that allows 
you to float more than a single instance of a crawler in the one JVM.  
Start the second and third instances either by creating a new instance 
of Heritrix via JMX or browse to the page '/local-instances.jsp' in the 
Heritrix UI.
>
> 2- Can a crawl order be reused automatically? For example, if I had
> 100 crawls orders, and Heritrix running, can I configure it so that
> after finishing the last crawl, start with the first (automatically),
> then the second, and so on?
There is a pending crawls queue.  You could fill this with your 100 
crawl jobs.  As the crawler finishes a job, it looks in the pending 
queue for the next job to crawl.
>
> 3- I don't know much about JMX; just started to read about it, but I
> wonder what functionlity Heritrix offers by JMX.
We should do better documentation of the JMX.  Here is what is best we 
have available currently: 
http://crawler.archive.org/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?JmxControlStatus.  There's 
also a note in the FAQ. 

Basically you can start, stop, pause, and monitor crawls.  You can also 
effect a subset of settings.

Best way to get an idea of whats available is to start Heritrix running 
using a 1.5.0 SUN JVM then connect using the jconsole tool (Its in 
$JAVA_HOME/bin).  Each Heritrix instance shows an MBean in the console 
with attributes, operations, and notifications (each with help).  Start 
a crawl job and see a new MBean appear, the CrawlJob MBean.  The MBean 
exposes most of the attributes from your crawl order, etc.
